datafield.subfield: Chiefly correspondence of John Quincy Adams dated 1801-1846. Also includes correspondence and miscellany relating to other family members.

titlestmt.subtitle: A Finding Aid to the Collection in the Library of Congress
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Nan Thompson Ernst

profiledesc.creation:
Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division,
2009

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Chiefly correspondence of John Quincy Adams dated 1801-1846. Also includes correspondence and miscellany relating to other family members.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.head: People
controlaccess.persname: Adams, Charles Francis, 1807-1886. Charles Francis Adams papers.
Adams, Charles Francis, 1835-1915. Charles Francis Adams papers.
Adams, John Quincy, 1767-1848. John Quincy Adams papers.
Adams, Louisa Catherine, 1775-1852. Louisa Catherine Adams papers.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers of the Adams Family were received by the Library of Congress through gift and purchase, 1901-2000.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Adams Family Papers were originally arranged in 1969. Material was added to the collection in 1974 and 2000 when a finding aid was created.

otherfindaid.head: Additional Guides
otherfindaid.p: An index to the correspondence of John Quincy Adams is available in the Manuscript Reading Room.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: The status of copyright in the unpublished writings of members of the Adams family is governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.).

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The records of the Adams family are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, Adams Family Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Adams Family Papers span the years 1776 to 1948 with the bulk dated 1794-1846. Chiefly comprising correspondence of John Quincy Adams, the collection also includes correspondence and other material relating to Abigail Adams, Charles Francis Adams (1807-1886), Charles Francis Adams (1835-1915), Henry Adams, John Adams, Louisa Catherine Adams, and Samuel Adams. Henry Adams included his address to the American Historical Association in a letter dated 1894 to Herbert Baxter Adams. Many of the items are transcripts, photocopies, and other reproductions. Some of the twentieth century items are explanatory cover letters or printed material. Other correspondents include Joseph Blunt, Alexander Hill Everett, Thomas Jefferson, James Madison, and Robert Welsh, Jr.

arrangement.p: The papers are arranged alphabetically by name of family member.

did.unittitle:
Seward, William H., to Adams, draft with notes,
1861

Facsimiles of Adams's signature, newspaper clipping,
1938

Account of the debate on the annexation of Texas in the U.S. House of Representatives, fragment,

Print from engraved portrait, with signature,
undated

Remarks to Congress at the death of William Soden Hastings, holograph,
1842, with note by Mary Earle, 1864

Seal impression made by great-granddaughter, Abigail Adams,
1896

Sketches of Adams and other negotiators of the Treaty of Ghent,
1815

“The Indestructible Church,” leaflet concerning church where Louisa and John Quincy Adams were married,
1941
